column2: 用全麦做的；用全麦面粉做的
column3: e.g. The cool temperature helps keep [[whole wheat]] flour fresh for longer.

column2: [C, U] 火腿（肉）
cook under or over direct heat 烤；烧；焙
column3: e.g. The meat tastes best when you [[grill]] it for 20 minutes on each side.

column2: make (bread, cheese, etc.) brown by placing it close to heat 烤，烘（面包、奶酪等）
column3: e.g. [[Toast]] the bread lightly on both sides and it will be ready.；e.g. I'd like a coffee and two slices of [[toast]] with butter.

column2: [U] bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft 烤面包（片）；吐司
column3: e.g. [[Toast]] the bread lightly on both sides and it will be ready.；e.g. I'd like a coffee and two slices of [[toast]] with butter.

column2: [C] a person who studies history and / or writes about it 历史学家；史学工作者
column3: e.g. His father is a famous [[historian]], specializing in the history of Germany.

column2: [U] the quality of being good at finding ways to deal with difficult situations 机智；有办法
column3: e.g. Because of his adventures, he is a person of far greater experience and [[resourcefulness]].

column2: [U] the process of entering another country to make one's life there 移居；移民入境
column3: e.g. The government has decided to tighten the [[immigration]] policy.

column2: [U]  the process of making sth. such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this 全球化
column3: e.g. Economic [[globalization]] has changed the nature of competition among cities in developing countries.

column2: [C, U] (pl. tuna or tunas) 金枪鱼（肉）
(fml.) (~ from / in) come from a particular place or start in a particular situation 开始；发源
column3: e.g. All theories [[originate]] from practice and in turn serve practice.

column2: reduce the amount of money, time, goods, etc. that you use 削减；节省
column3: e.g. He tried to [[conserve]] on fuel during the long winter.；e.g. We must [[conserve]] our forests and woodlands for our future generations.

column2: keep sth. from being wasted, damaged, lost, or destroyed 保护；保存
column3: e.g. He tried to [[conserve]] on fuel during the long winter.；e.g. We must [[conserve]] our forests and woodlands for our future generations.

column2: [U, sing.] a larger amount of sth. than is allowed or needed 过分；过量
column3: e.g. The test revealed an [[excess]] of alcohol in the driver's blood.

column2: (~s) [pl.] food remaining uneaten after a meal 剩饭菜
column3: e.g. At my grandma's, we sometimes had [[leftovers]] and it was my grandpa who ate them.；e.g. This recipe makes use of [[leftover]] chicken from the roast chicken recipe.

column2: (only before noun) remaining after all the rest has been used, taken, or eaten 未用完的；剩余的；未吃完的
column3: e.g. At my grandma's, we sometimes had [[leftovers]] and it was my grandpa who ate them.；e.g. This recipe makes use of [[leftover]] chicken from the roast chicken recipe.

column2: [U] 蛋黄酱
[C, U] 莴苣；生菜
1) [C, U] behavior and attitudes that most people in a society consider to be normal and right 惯例；常规；习俗
column3: e.g. It is a matter of [[convention]] that businessmen should wear suits.；e.g. They have chosen him to represent their city at the [[convention]].

column2: 2) [C] a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests 大会；会议；集会
column3: e.g. It is a matter of [[convention]] that businessmen should wear suits.；e.g. They have chosen him to represent their city at the [[convention]].

column2: 1) movement (as of goods or people) into, through, and out of a place （货物、人员等的）流动，流通；吞吐
column3: e.g. The restaurant did a lively business and had a rapid [[turnover]].；e.g. I believe they've doubled their [[turnover]] since those advertisements appeared in the press.

column2: 2) [U, sing.] (BrE) the amount of business done during a particular period 营业额
column3: e.g. The restaurant did a lively business and had a rapid [[turnover]].；e.g. I believe they've doubled their [[turnover]] since those advertisements appeared in the press.

column2: (of food) preserved in a tin （食物）罐装的
column3: e.g. They tend to buy cheap processed foods like [[canned]] chicken.

column2: [sing.] the disadvantage or negative aspect of sth. 不利方面
column3: e.g. There is a [[downside]] of living in the countryside: It takes a long time to commute to work.

column2: [U] the state of being liked, enjoyed, or supported by a large number of people 流行；受欢迎
column3: e.g. We are doing a weekly poll on the president, and clearly his [[popularity]] has declined.

column2: not deliberate 无意的；无心的
column3: e.g. Technological advances are sometimes accompanied by [[unintended]] consequences such as pollution and global warming.

column2: 1) (~s) [pl.] food left after a meal 残羹剩饭
column3: e.g. The rats run around, searching for [[scraps]] in the rubbish.；e.g. He wrote his address on a [[scrap]] of paper.

column2: 2) [C] a small piece of paper, cloth, etc. 小片；小块；碎屑
column3: e.g. The rats run around, searching for [[scraps]] in the rubbish.；e.g. He wrote his address on a [[scrap]] of paper.

column2: [C, U] the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong 良心；良知
column3: e.g. I have battled with my [[conscience]] over whether I should actually send this letter.

column2: [U] the study of the environment and the belief that it must be protected from damage by human activities 环境保护主义
column3: e.g. The teacher asked the students to find more information on [[environmentalism]] on the Internet.

column2: [C] a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills （社会）精英；上层人士
column3: e.g. In this country, only the [[elite]] can afford an education for their children.

column2: [C] a metal pan over a heater, used to cook or to keep things warm at the table （有加热装置的）火锅，暖锅
column3: e.g. Last Friday I got back to town and had [[chafing dishes]] with my family members.

column2: [C] 三角形；三角形物体
[C] 牙签
1) [U] the act of combining or state of being combined 联合；组合
column3: e.g. After running through the numbers in every possible [[combination]], we finally hit on a solution.；e.g. The best approach may well be to use a [[combination]] of both methods.

column2: 2) [C] two or more things joined or mixed together to form a single unit 结合体；联合体；混合体
column3: e.g. After running through the numbers in every possible [[combination]], we finally hit on a solution.；e.g. The best approach may well be to use a [[combination]] of both methods.

column2: [U] the quality of being attractive and showing a good sense of style 高雅
column3: e.g. In the dining room the decoration creates an atmosphere of [[elegance]].

column2: lasting or intended to last for a long time or forever 长久的；永久的
column3: e.g. Heavy drinking can cause [[permanent]] damage to the brain.

column2: 1) food cooked in a certain way 菜肴；饭菜
column3: e.g. The dining room has lakeside views and offers excellent [[cuisine]].；e.g. Chinese [[cuisine]] is an art, which grew out of a highly developed civilization.

column2: 2) a particular style of cooking 烹饪（法）
column3: e.g. The dining room has lakeside views and offers excellent [[cuisine]].；e.g. Chinese [[cuisine]] is an art, which grew out of a highly developed civilization.

column2: not liking changes or new ideas 保守的；守旧的
column3: e.g. The young people are the most eager to learn and the least [[conservative]] in their thinking.

column2: [U] dislike of changes or new ideas 保守；守旧主义
column3: e.g. Jones himself was a curious mixture of radicalism (激进主义) and [[conservatism]].

column2: [U] the quality of remaining faithful to your friends, principles, country, etc. 忠诚；忠贞；忠实
column3: e.g. I was deeply impressed by his [[loyalty]] to his brother.

column2: small, pretty, and delicate 小巧的；精致的
column3: e.g. We visited her uncle's place and were given tea and some [[dainty]] little cakes.

column2: [U] 炒面
[C] a university degree of the highest level 博士学位
column3: e.g. He received his [[doctorate]] in political science at Columbia University.

column2: [C] sth. which cannot be explained or understood 神秘的事；不可思议的事
column3: e.g. It's a [[mystery]] to me how she ever passed that exam.

column2: for the stated kind and no other; particularly 专门地；特定地；具体地
column3: e.g. I asked her to repeat [[specifically]] the words that Patti had used.

1) of a very typical and well-known kind 典型的
column3: e.g. Too many job hunters make the [[classic]] mistake of thinking only about what's in it for them.；e.g. Huckleberry Finn is a [[classic]] children's movie.

column2: 2) of the highest quality or class and esp. serving as a model 一流的；经典的
column3: e.g. Too many job hunters make the [[classic]] mistake of thinking only about what's in it for them.；e.g. Huckleberry Finn is a [[classic]] children's movie.

column2: (of food) making one's stomach feel full （食物）耐饥的，果腹的
column3: e.g. Although it is tasty, crab is not very [[filling]].

column2: eat sth. steadily and often noisily, esp. sth. hard and / or dry 大声嚼，用力嚼（尤其硬或干的食物）
column3: e.g. The horse was [[munching]] away at my hat.

column2: [C] (esp. BrE) （工厂、学校等的）食堂，餐厅
[C] （美国和加拿大的）十分硬币
[C] (infml.) a person living in a foreign country 居住在国外的人；侨民
column3: e.g. I had the vague idea that I could now vote electronically, but in fact no [[expat]] can do so.

column2: ask sb. for help 请求···的帮助
column3: e.g. She urged him to [[reach out to]] his family.

column2: that you choose by yourself 自己选择（或选定）的
column3: e.g. Meals on a tour like ours could be eaten in any restaurant of one's [[choosing]].

column2: (make you) eat enough food so that you no longer feel hungry 使吃饱
column3: e.g. They [[filled]] me up with cakes and sandwiches.

column2: if you start sth. from scratch, you begin it without using anything that existed or was prepared before 从头做起；从零开始
column3: e.g. It's completely ruined, so we'll have to start from scratch.

column2: think of an idea, answer, etc. 想出，提出（主意、答案等）
column3: e.g. The airline has [[come up with]] a novel solution to the problem of jet lag.

column2: (AmE) (of cooked food sold in a shop) be taken away and not eaten in the shop （食物）带出餐馆吃的，外卖的
column3: e.g. "Two chicken dinners with corn [[to go]], please," he said in a hurry.

column2: need sth. 需要
column3: e.g. This kind of work [[calls for]] a lot of patience.

column2: up to and including the present moment 至今
column3: e.g. Even [[to this day]] we don't know what happened for sure.

column2: because of 由于；因为
column3: e.g. The company has had a successful year, thanks to the improvement in export sales.

column2: [C, U] the act of admitting one’s crimes, faults, etc. 承认；坦白
column3: e.g. I have a [[confession]] to make — I scraped (擦坏) your car when I was parking mine.

column2: use all or most of your time, effort, etc. in order to do sth. or help sb. 致力；献身；倾注
column3: e.g. After graduating from law school, he [[devoted]] his energies to writing film scripts.

column2: showing great fondness or loyalty; caring a great deal 忠实的；热爱···的
column3: e.g. There is absolutely no doubt that this woman was a totally [[devoted]] and caring mother.

column2: impossible to satisfy 无法满足的
column3: e.g. The public has an [[insatiable]] appetite for stories about famous people.

column2: [C] a very strong desire for sth. 渴望；热望
column3: e.g. Surprisingly, his headache and fatigue subsided (减轻) and his [[craving]] for alcohol disappeared.

column2: coming from, found in, or typical of the tropics 来自热带的；产于热带的；热带的
column3: e.g. Under normal conditions, the ocean currents of the [[tropical]] Pacific travel from east to west.

column2: difficult in an interesting or enjoyable way 富有挑战性的

column3: e.g. I felt I had [[adjusted]] to the idea of being a mother very well.

1) the power or opportunity to use sb. / sth. 处置权
column3: e.g. During their visit, I left my car at their [[disposal]].；e.g. We should not give up this option for the [[disposal]] of nuclear waste.

column2: 2) the act or means of getting rid of sth. 清理；处理
column3: e.g. During their visit, I left my car at their [[disposal]].；e.g. We should not give up this option for the [[disposal]] of nuclear waste.

column2: 1) examine or consider with attention and in detail 仔细研究；仔细考虑
column3: e.g. Officials of the union are [[perusing]] the deal.；e.g. She found the information while she was [[perusing]] a copy of Life magazine.

column2: 2) (fml.) read sth, esp. in a careful way 读；（尤指）细读，精读
column3: e.g. Officials of the union are [[perusing]] the deal.；e.g. She found the information while she was [[perusing]] a copy of Life magazine.

column2: 1) in a worried or unhappy way 担忧地；不快地
column3: e.g. "We have to get those windows open," I announced [[grimly]] to my husband.；e.g. "Now, I can wait for you," he said [[grimly]], "but hurry up."

column2: 2) seriously 严肃地
column3: e.g. "We have to get those windows open," I announced [[grimly]] to my husband.；e.g. "Now, I can wait for you," he said [[grimly]], "but hurry up."

column3: e.g. The apples we bought yesterday are kind of [[mealy]].

column2: of a light shade of red 浅粉红色的
column3: e.g. Her nostrils (鼻孔) were [[pinkish]], as though she had a cold.

column2: [C, U] 卷心莴苣

column3: e.g. He [[wrapped]] a bandage around my injured wrist.

column2: [C] the piece of paper or plastic that covers sth. when it is sold （商品的）包装纸（塑料）
column3: e.g. The kids were asked to put the sweet [[wrappers]] into the rubbish bin.

column2: [C, U] the skin of some fruit and vegetables, esp. the thick skin of fruit such as oranges, which you do not eat （水果和蔬菜的）外皮（尤指橙子等不能食用的厚皮）
column3: e.g. Usually, we speak of orange [[peel]] and apple [[peel]], but of tomato skin.；e.g. She sat down in the kitchen and began to [[peel]] potatoes.

column2: remove the skin from fruit or vegetables 剥去（削去）（水果或蔬菜）的皮
column3: e.g. Usually, we speak of orange [[peel]] and apple [[peel]], but of tomato skin.；e.g. She sat down in the kitchen and began to [[peel]] potatoes.

column2: 1) not having a lot of experience of life 不谙世故的；天真的
column3: e.g. I cannot believe you have such [[unworldly]] views on things as a grown man.；e.g. The singer seems somewhat [[unworldly]] because he hates commercial advertising and social activities.

column2: 2) not interested in money or possessions 对钱财不感兴趣；脱俗的
column3: e.g. I cannot believe you have such [[unworldly]] views on things as a grown man.；e.g. The singer seems somewhat [[unworldly]] because he hates commercial advertising and social activities.

column2: having or showing good education, manners, and an interest in art, music, literature, etc. 有文化的；有教养的；有修养的
column3: e.g. The people who will be on the committee are moral, [[cultured]], and competent.

column2: [U, sing.]  the process of becoming aware of sth. 认识；意识；领悟
column3: e.g. There is now a growing [[realization]] that things cannot go on like this for much longer.

column2: 1) (take sb.  sth. that you do not recognize their true value any more and do not show that you are grateful （因习以为常）视···为理所当然（而对其不重视）
column3: e.g. I came into adult life clueless about a lot of things that most people take for [[granted]].；e.g. In response to the lawyer's appeals, the Home Secretary [[granted]] a free pardon (赦免).

column2: 2) (fml.) give sb. sth. or allow them to have sth. that they have asked for 给予；准予
column3: e.g. I came into adult life clueless about a lot of things that most people take for [[granted]].；e.g. In response to the lawyer's appeals, the Home Secretary [[granted]] a free pardon (赦免).

column2: 1) [C] the reason why you want to do sth. 动机；原因
column3: e.g. What was your [[motivation]] for becoming a doctor?；e.g. Jack is an intelligent pupil, but he lacks [[motivation]].

column2: 2) [U] eagerness and willingness to do sth. without needing to be told or forced to do it 动力；积极性
column3: e.g. What was your [[motivation]] for becoming a doctor?；e.g. Jack is an intelligent pupil, but he lacks [[motivation]].

column2: [C] sth. that needs attention, consideration, service, etc. before others 优先处理的事；当务之急
column3: e.g. After several burglaries (入室盗窃) in the area, security is now a high [[priority]].

column2: of the color of gold 金色的
column3: e.g. He was so attracted by the girl with [[golden]] hair that he did not hear anything his father said.

column2: [C, U] 蛋黄
[sing.] the sound of sth. being crushed or like sth. being crushed or broken 嘎吱的响声
column3: e.g. I heard a loud [[crunch]] as the truck ran into the wall.

column2: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods 不使用化肥的；有机的；绿色的
column3: e.g. Now [[organic]] farming is expanding everywhere in China.

column2: relating to a type of farming which allows animals such as chickens and pigs to move around and eat naturally, rather than being kept in a restricted space 放养的；散养的
column3: e.g. She says that [[free-range]] chickens taste much better than factory-farmed ones.

column2: (fml.) take part in an activity or event 参加；参与
column3: e.g. China will actively [[participate]] in global affairs and play a constructive role in maintaining world peace.

column2: [C, usu. pl.] 耳塞（小型耳机）
become or make sth. become liquid as a result of heating （使）熔化，融化
column3: e.g. The snow had [[melted]], but the lake was still frozen solid.

column2: [U] (fml.) food which keeps people or animals strong and healthy 营养；食物
column3: e.g. Throughout human history we have depended on nature for [[sustenance]], well-being, and development.

column2: very great 巨大的；重大的
column3: e.g. The mother's behavior has a [[profound]] impact on the developing child.

column2: having a great influence or effect 影响深远的
column3: e.g. The report outlines the most [[far-reaching]] changes in housing policy for 30 years.

column2: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad 严重的；重大的；严峻的
column3: e.g. The situation poses a [[grave]] threat to world peace.；e.g. She tore the rose apart and scattered the petals (花瓣) over the [[grave]].

column2: [C] a place in the ground where a dead body is buried 墓穴；坟墓
column3: e.g. The situation poses a [[grave]] threat to world peace.；e.g. She tore the rose apart and scattered the petals (花瓣) over the [[grave]].

column2: [C, U] a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement 预言；预测
column3: e.g. He was unwilling to make a [[prediction]] about which books would sell well in the coming year.

column2: pass or assist sb. in passing (a difficult, testing experience, or period) 熬过或助人熬过（困境）
column3: e.g. I don't know how we're going to [[get through]] the winter.

column2: laugh, or cause others to laugh, rather unkindly at 嘲笑；取笑
column3: e.g. People [[make fun of]] her because she wears such a strange hat.

column2: able to be used freely by sb. 供某人支配
column3: e.g. We will use all the means at our disposal to solve this problem.

column2: recognize sb. / sth. in a group of people or things 分辨出；辨认出
column3: e.g. Steven describes himself as "a regular guy — you couldn't [[pick out]] me out of a crowd."

column2: not tell anyone about sth. 把···秘而不宣；不将···说出去
column3: e.g. I have to tell someone. I can't [[keep it to myself]].

column2: be very different from sth; not be connected with sth. 与···大相径庭；与···不相干
column3: e.g. Many of these books are far removed from the reality of children's lives.

column2: be dependent on 依靠
column3: e.g. They have to [[rely on]] the river for their water.

column2: (of fruit or vegetables) easily available and ready to eat because it is the right time of year for them （水果或蔬菜）当令的
column3: e.g. These are the dog days (伏天); watermelons are just in season.

column2: following in order or importance after sb. / sth. 仅次于；紧接
column3: e.g. [[Next to]] biology, I like physics best.

column2: mostly; usually 通常；多半
column3: e.g. These small pieces of land were purchased [[for the most part]] by local people.

column2: in the future 在将来；今后
column3: e.g. She might be able to help you pursue a promotion [[down the road]].
